com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server
Class MCServer

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server.MCServer

public class MCServer
extends java.lang.Object

This is the multi client server. For every connection it creates a new thread for the client.

Author:
Christopher Rabotin

Method Detail

getListening

public static boolean getListening()
Checks whether the server should be running.

Returns:
listening

startServer

public static void startServer()
                        throws java.io.IOException
This method starts the multi client server.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if we cannot close the socket

stopServer

public static void stopServer()
This method prevents two or more new clients to connect. Since accept() is a blocking method and already called, one more new client can connect to the server before it is stopped. However, that exception is taken care of in the Client.java constructor.
